Great game, now working with Workshop, and you can make a great variety of fun and explorable levels. It is a 3D first person puzzle games, and there is not many games in that category as extraordinary as this one is. If you are looking for a fun game that can stretch your mind and is also fun to play, buy Portal 2!

Tip: You can also get the game by buying it on PS3, behind the manual was a code to get it on steam for me, not sure if its like that on the XBOX 360, but I think it is a great deal.

Valve's puzzles are the best, both single player and co-op, but if you want a real challenge, many of the community-made maps in the workshop are devilishly difficult, to the point where I gave up on many of them. (Hence, I didn't like a lot of them, but there were a few that were just easy enough to be satisfying.)

Отменное чувство юмора разработчиков не дает устать от игровой головоломки из которой по сути и состоит игра! Отличное продолжение первой части, интересный сюжет, все на достойном уровне и порой превосходит ожидания!

Portal 2 is fun, challenging and unlike any other game out there, save maybe Portal 1.  It's all about the puzzle.  Can you solve your way to the end of the level?  

Portal 2 is chock full of good, clean, silly humor and failry difficult puzzles that are sure to entice your more clever senses whle putting a smile on your face.  Also, there is a co-op option to entangle yourself in a "test chamber" with a friend online or in LAN.  Hooray teamwork! If that's not enough, you can also build your own level with a built-in SDK that allows you to design, test and deploy your custom designed level onto the Steam servers for all of us to enjoy!  Portal 2 in a fantabulous, magnificent  exercise in awesomeness!

In my opinion, this is THE best game ever. The physics used, the puzzles, and the humor is just awesome. If I were you, I would buy right now.

Love this game. Stuck about halfway through though, can't seem to get past this one level and I am too stubborn to look up a walkthrough. 

Also, for some reason if I play for longer than about 30 minutes, I start to get motion sick. No idea why, as I have never had this problem with any other game. A friend recommended turning on v-sync. Didn't help. 

Even with this weird issue (which I am sure is just me, don't let it discourage anyone from playing this) I still find small time-chunks to play the game.

This game is simply wonderful.  Espcially if you enjoy sarcasim, the running dialog will keep a smerk on your face.  The single player is signigicantly longer than the first game and the constant plot twists will keep you engagaged.

I would say Portal 2 was my most enjoyable gaming experince, EVER.  I do recomend playing the original Portal first as it gives more depth to the story and experince of Portal 2.

The co-op mode is also fantastic, but the puzzels can be quite tricky.  Pick your partner wisely. ;-)

one of the best games i ever plade

Portal 2 isn't just a sequel to a physics-based puzzle game, it is the triumphant return to Aperture Science; what lacked the first Portal was a stronger narrative, Valve fixed this issue and delivered a story driven puzzle game, adding new elements to the award winning formula made back in 2007, a better soundtrack, highly improved graphics and varied testing chambers. Although the game may seem short, it will still be one of the best times you will have in your life.

+Portal gun strikes again
+Improved graphics
+Amazing narrative 
+Attractive soundtrack
+New testing elements
+Fun Co-op

98/100 [b]Masterpiece[/b]

(This review is for the single player game only) For those not familiar, Portal and Portal II are puzzle games that use the same viewpoint and controls of a first-person-shooter. Not quite as groundbreaking as the first Portal, but miles ahead in terms of graphics and gameplay. A bunch of new gameplay mechanics were added, and the mood and graphics were enhanced compared to the first Portal. The game seemed longer, and the humor was great. The comic relief character Wheatley played by Stephen Merchant was excellent. There are parts of the game that are very dark and foreboding, parts that are ridiculous and zany, and parts that are just plain weird. This is a must-play game for anyone that likes puzzles, a true classic game.
